info.desc: Mark up the name of a file or directory.

page.title: Filenames
page.p: The file element marks the name of a file or directory. It may also be used to mark collections or portions of filenames, such as search paths and file extensions.

item.p: The style attribute takes a space-separated list of style hints. Processing tools should adjust their rendering according to those style hints they understand.
The file element can link to other pages or documents. See for more information.
The file element can have attributes from external namespaces. See for more information on external-namespace attributes on inline elements.

section.title: Processing Expectations
section.p: Filenames should be rendered in a fixed-width or wide font to reduce ambiguity between visually similar characters.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: The file element is similar to the filename element in DocBook.
